      • filename

        java.lang.String filename

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReadingsArray

        public ReadingsArray​(java.lang.String filename)
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Instantiates a ReadingArray object to hold RGBReadings, reading the data from this file.

        Note: this will crash if the file is not structured the correct way. That's fine.

        It will also throw the FileNotFoundException if the file cannot be opened. That's also fine.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to be sorted through.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be opened.

    • Method Detail

      • getDate

        public java.lang.String getDate()
        Returns the date of these readings.
        Returns:
        the date of these readings.

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Returns the number of RGBReadings in this object.
        Returns:
        the number of RGBReadings in this object.

      • minMax

        public RGBReading[] minMax()
        Returns the RGBReadings with the shortest and longest times.

        Shortest is stored at index [0], longest is at [1]. The returned array should have length 2.

        Returns:
        the RGBReadings with the shortest and longest times.

      • posRedChangeCount

        public int posRedChangeCount()
        Returns the count of how many times the red value increases between each sequential RGBReading, based on the order they are stored in the ReadingsArray object.

        Specifically, count if the red value increases from the first RGBReading to the second, count if the red value increases between the second and third RGBReading, etc

        Returns:
        the count of how many times the red value increases between each sequential RGBReading.

      • findSmallestGap

        public RGBReading[] findSmallestGap()
        Returns an array containing two RGBReading objects who had the smallest absolute value difference in brightness levels.

        This is between any two RGBReadings in the ReadingsArray, not necessarily consecutive.

        Returns:
        an array containing two RGBReading objects

      • save

        public void save​(java.lang.String filename)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Writes the brightness values for all the RGBReading objects to the file specified.

        The first line of the file is the date, followed by each RGBReading name and its brightness, separated by a space. One RGBReading per line.

        Parameters:
        filename - A parameter
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - for a null argument.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String that represents the state of this object.

        The String should start with the date, followed by the toString() for each RGBReading object, separated by a new line character.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String that represents the state of this object.
